text: Hey <!channel> - Apologies for my calendar today, which has the unfortunate side effect of my own personal silence after yesterday. There's a few fronts that I believe will be helpful, starting with that Google doc of other sites that Matt shared out post-meeting. Think the more ammo we have in there that can start to illuminate a bit more ideas, conceptual directions, dos/dont's, etc — the better.
I'm going to be working as much as possible in that, as well as helping get us to a contractual understanding with them in parallel
i'm also 100% open to whatever y'all think will be helpful here. Just typing from another meeting while it's in my head
but for record, feel free to meet without me to push stuff forward.
I’m also distilling my notes into some design principles to keep us all aligned internally and tracking toward the right goals
cool. Feel free to whiteboard, ideate, whatever makes sense.
hoping to really make this an output of our team overall, which will greatly benefit from as much collab as possible.
that's you too <@U02613K0X> :wink:

<@U0265G76F>: When you’re free we should round up as a team and figure out what that means. Agree that collab is key but want to avoid redundancy and make sure everyone knows what they should be focusing on.
agreed
i'd like very much for you all to meet and come up with recommendatins on that front. Today's not going to happen for me due to many other client conflicts
sounds good - <@U026PLK4S> <@U0518TGU8> <@U02613K0X> not sure what your schedules are like today, but let’s try and round up sometime after lunch?
I can take a look at calendars and put something on the books
works for me!
sounds good!
<@U0260V1BX> i'd like to be in that meeting. could you add me? or if you haven't set something up yet, i can. thanks!
i’ll add you!
thank you!
Was chatting with evans and just now seeing all this, thanks <@U0260V1BX> for scheduling that
<@U0265G76F> <@U04JZANJF> can we contact Magnum and find out what bluehost plan they've got and request login credentials to their hosting account?
on it
thanks!
Google has some early-access Arabic fonts that they will consider mainstreaming with their other Web Fonts, if they are popular and get enough usage. <https://www.google.com/fonts/earlyaccess>
previews here: <http://codepen.io/mdjasper/full/Fzjtg>

attachments.title: Arabic Web Fonts
attachments.text: Arabic language web fonts available from Google's early access program...

text: It didn't even occur to me until this morning that Arabic is right to left
I think that's partially why they may want to isolate translation to limited support

<@U0260V1BX|melissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F066NGQ1G/07_acef_book.pdf|07 ACEF Book.pdf> and commented: If you guys haven’t yet, take a look at this example PDF that Oussama sent over. It’s also on the NAS.

initial_comment.comment: If you guys haven’t yet, take a look at this example PDF that Oussama sent over. It’s also on the NAS.

text: He said this was the level of translation support they’re hoping for. Which looks like just translated project titles and not much more. This points to a single version of the site that has both Arabic and English text on it, as opposed to an English version and an Arabic version.
Ooh interesting. So that makes it look like no intelligent text swapping, just text in both languages living side by side on the same screen.
we’ll have to confirm with them, but that’s how it seems
Good call. I thought it was a reference for how much text they’d want to translate. Meaning they wanted to translate. Which makes sense, since a printed piece can’t change languages.
Graphically, i think it adds a bit of interest. (Although, I have no clue how to set arabic text)
agreed - itll create a nice contrast
<@U02613K0X> <@U04JZANJF> <@U026PLK4S> we’re meeting in glass
